DefaultSegmentDeliveryConfiguration.description: The optional configuration for a server that serves segments. Use this if you want the segment delivery server to be different from the source location server. For example, you can configure your source location server to be an origination server, such as MediaPackage, and the segment delivery server to be a content delivery network (CDN), such as CloudFront. If you don't specify a segment delivery server, then the source location server is used.

properties.name: BaseUrl
properties.description: The hostname of the server that will be used to serve segments. This string must include the protocol, such as https://.

type.description: The hostname of the server that will be used to serve segments. This string must include the protocol, such as https://.

HttpConfiguration.description: The HTTP configuration for the source location.

properties.name: BaseUrl
properties.description: The base URL for the source location host server. This string must include the protocol, such as https://.

type.description: The base URL for the source location host server. This string must include the protocol, such as https://.

SecretsManagerAccessTokenConfiguration.description: AWS Secrets Manager access token configuration parameters. For information about Secrets Manager access token authentication, see Working with AWS Secrets Manager access token authentication.

properties.name: HeaderName
properties.description: The name of the HTTP header used to supply the access token in requests to the source location.

type.description: The name of the HTTP header used to supply the access token in requests to the source location.

properties.name: SecretArn
properties.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Secrets Manager secret that contains the access token.

type.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Secrets Manager secret that contains the access token.

properties.name: SecretStringKey
properties.description: The AWS Secrets Manager SecretString key associated with the access token. MediaTailor uses the key to look up SecretString key and value pair containing the access token.

type.description: The AWS Secrets Manager SecretString key associated with the access token. MediaTailor uses the key to look up SecretString key and value pair containing the access token.

properties.name: BaseUrl
properties.description: The base URL of the host or path of the segment delivery server that you're using to serve segments. This is typically a content delivery network (CDN). The URL can be absolute or relative. To use an absolute URL include the protocol, such as https://example.com/some/path. To use a relative URL specify the relative path, such as /some/path*.

type.description: The base URL of the host or path of the segment delivery server that you're using to serve segments. This is typically a content delivery network (CDN). The URL can be absolute or relative. To use an absolute URL include the protocol, such as https://example.com/some/path. To use a relative URL specify the relative path, such as /some/path*.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: A unique identifier used to distinguish between multiple segment delivery configurations in a source location.

type.description: A unique identifier used to distinguish between multiple segment delivery configurations in a source location.

properties.name: SegmentDeliveryConfigurations
properties.description: A list of the segment delivery configurations associated with this resource.

type.description: A list of the segment delivery configurations associated with this resource.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: The tags to assign to the source location.

type.description: The tags to assign to the source location.
